snippet: New rules have been imposed that will protect the safety of the horses before the Belmont Stakes, but the industry still needs effective reform.
abstract: Editorial contends that the extraordinary security measures implemented to guard horses at the Belmont Stakes should make the horse racing industry ashamed; calls for more effective reform, including more forceful anti-doping measures and penalties, to address the industry's long history of scandal, bankruptcy and racehorse fatalities.
lead_paragraph: New rules have been imposed that will protect the safety of the horses before the Belmont Stakes, but the industry still needs effective reform.
